description: Dropbox is the latest tech company to get caught up in the investment wave in Silicon Valley
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, November 19, 2013
contentencoded: Dropbox is the latest tech company to get caught up in the investment wave in Silicon Valley. The file storage and sharing service wants to be valued at $8 billion. Ashley Vance, technology correspondent at Bloomberg Businessweek, tells Marketplace Tech host Ben Johnson more.
contenttemplated:
[{"content":"

Dropbox is the latest tech company to get caught up in the investment wave in Silicon Valley. The file storage and sharing service wants to be valued at $8 billion. Ashley Vance, technology correspondent at Bloomberg Businessweek, tells Marketplace Tech host Ben Johnson more.

teaser: Dropbox is the latest tech company to get caught up in the investment wave in Silicon Valley
title: Dropbox wants to be worth $8 billion
